Your Guide to iOS Dev Twitter

Feb 1, 2019

Here I should be listing (and categorizing) the most useful iOS Developer Twitter accounts to follow.

Last week, I found myself taking a colleague in a tour through Twitter accounts and telling him about what accounts to follow if he wants to learn about specific something (about iOS). He responded, ‚Äúyou should share this.‚Äù So, driven by guilt (my #1 motivation), I write this in hope of someone finding it useful.

This is not an exhaustive list (for sure!); maybe I dropped someone (or more), and of course more creative people are going to rise in the future. Help me make this list age well!

Teachers

Amazing people who grok challenging subjects and write easy-to-digest articles and tutorials.

  • John Sundell
  • Paul Hudson
  • Keith Harrison
  • Bart Jacobs

Golden Members

People I can‚Äôt imagine the iOS community without them.

  • Peter Steinberger
  • Nick Lockwood
  • Rob Mayoff
  • Dave DeLong

Artists

Bright minds that write impressive articles regarding lesser known/niche topics.

  • Matt Thompson
  • Soroush Khanlou

Low-level

They usually post on low-level stuff, performance, cryptography, ‚Ä¶etc. Need high-usage of brain power to follow üòÖ
